forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. West southwest wind around 8 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 5pm. Partly sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 3 to 13 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, the city finds itself clothed in a veil of clammy cloud cover, hinting at the day ahead. The air is cool, wrapping itself around you with a gentle grip, and though the sun may attempt to assert itself, it will be in a dance with rain as the hours unfold. Visibility, while not hopelessly obscured, remains tempered, with the horizon blurred by the moisture-laden atmosphere. A light breeze drifts through the streets, carrying whispers of impending showers.

This Friday promises an interesting interplay of weather; expect the clouds to deepen as the day marches toward evening. As the clock strikes five, the rains are set to arrive, transforming the serene autumn atmosphere into a cozy retreat indoors. Dressing in layers would be prudent; a light jacket should suffice against the chill, while waterproof shoes could save you a squelchy fate on your afternoon outings. Given this atmospheric spectacle, why not explore the local cafés and enjoy a moment of quiet reflection with a warm drink in hand? Alternatively, a leisurely stroll along the waterfront might provide a spirited antidote to the impending drizzle, allowing you to soak in the gray hues of the Bay.
